title: Ticket #5138: Update documentation to reflect ADMINISTRATOR condor_fetchlog req
description:
After implementing SSL authentication and authorization in the CHTC pool, Greg Thain's CHTC hour-reporting scripts began failing. They utilize condor_fetchlog, which requires the ADMINISTRATOR access level on target HTCondor daemons.

HTCondor manual section 3.6.1.1 describes access levels. It does not mention that the ADMINISTRATOR access level is necessary for condor_fetchlog. It should probably be added.

Cheers, Moate
remarks: There is already a note about this in the condor_fetchlog man page. Another note is now added to the security section of the manual, where access levels (and a few examples) are described.
check_ins: 2015-Aug-07 13:10   Check-in [45526]: condor_fetchlog requires ADMINISTRATOR access level #5138 (By Karen Miller )
creator: moate
